# Question

You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md::AbstractString)
    questions = findall(r"^# Question\s*$", md) .+ 1
    answers = findall(r"^# Answer\s*$", md) .+ 1
    
    if isempty(questions) || length(questions) != length(answers)
        return nothing
    end
    
    question_texts = map(questions) do q_start
        findnext(r"^# Question\s*$", md, q_start)[2] - 1
    end
    answer_texts = map(answers) do a_start
        findnext(r"^# Answer\s*$", md, a_start)[2] - 1
    end
    
    questions = strip.(md[question_texts])
    answers = strip.(md[answer_texts])
    
    return zip(questions, answers)
end
```

This function uses regular expressions to find the start of each `# Question` and `# Answer` section in the markdown text. It then strips leading spaces and newlines from the extracted texts and returns a tuple of questions and answers. If there are no matching sections or if the number of questions does not match the number of answers, the function returns `nothing`.
